A device used in Fishing for drill pipe. If the upper end of the lost pipe is leaning against the side of the Well, the wall Hook centers it in the Hole so that it may be recovered with an Overshot, which is run on the Fishing String and attached to the wall Hook
Washing job, actions or job's abbreviations which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
انجام عملیات شستشو
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
wsh

To release pipe that is stuck in the Hole by running Washover Pipe. The Washover Pipe must have an outside diameter small enough to fit into the Borehole but an inside diameter large enough to fit over the outside diameter of the stuck Pipe. A Rotary Shoe, which cuts away the Formation, Mud, or whatever is sticking the Pipe, is made up on the bottom joint of the Washover Pipe, and the assembly is lowered into the Hole. Rotation of the assembly frees the stuck Pipe. Several Washovers may have to be made if the stuck portion is very long
WW
The high
pressure spraying of the Crude Oil cargo to dislodge or dissolve clingage and sediment from the Walls, Cross Members, and Lines in the compartments of a vessel during the unloading operation
. The use of a high
pressure water stream to dislodge clingage and sediment from the Bulkheads, Bottoms, and internal structures of a vessel's cargo tanks
WAS, washing anything on the Rig, actions or job's abbreviations which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports

The operation during which stuck Drill Stem or Tubing is freed using Washover Pipe
A device employed to protect Seals, Seating Nipples, etc., during Mill
out operations
A short length of surface
hardened pipe that fits inside the Swivel and serves as a Conduit for drilling fluid through the Swivel
. Sometimes used to mean Washover Pipe

W/C
Water put into an empty string of pipe in a Well to prevent the Pipe from being crushed by pressure in the Annulus
The reservoir drive mechanism in which Oil is produced by the expansion of the underlying water and rock, which forces the Oil into the Well. In general, there are two types of Water Drive: Bottom
water Drive, in which the Oil is totally underlain by water; and Edgewater Drive, in which only a portion of the Oil is in contact with the water

A drilling Mud in which the continuous phase is water. In Water
gas Muds, any additives are dispersed in the water. Compare also with : Oil

A Hole drilled in the earth for purpose of 1 finding or producing Crude Oil or Natural Gas; or 2 providing services related to the production of Crude Oil or Natural Gas

The activities and methods of preparing a Well for the production of Oil and Gas or for other purposes, such as Injection; the method by which one or more flow paths for Hydrocarbons are established between the reservoir and the surface
. The system of Tubulars, Packers, and other tools installed beneath the Wellhead in the Production Casing; that is, the tool assembly that provides the Hydrocarbon flow path or paths

The recording of information about subsurface Geologic Formations, including records kept by the driller and records of Mud and Cutting analyses, Core analysis, Drill Stem Tests, and Electric, Acoustic, and Radioactivity procedures. See also : Acoustic Log, Core analysis, Driller's Log, Drill Stem Test, Electric Well Log, Mud analysis, and Radioactivity Well Logging
A member of a Well
Servicing crew

The maintenance work performed on an Oil or Gas Well to improve or maintain the production from a Formation already producing. It usually involves repairs to the Pump, Rods, Gas Lift Valves, Tubing, Packers, and so forth
w srtd
بخوبی جور شده
A Borehole; the Hole drilled by the Bit. A Wellbore may have Casing in it or it may be open uncased ; or part of it may be cased, and part of it may be open. Also called a Borehole or hole
The equipment installed at the surface of the Well. A Wellhead includes such equipment as the Casinghead and Tubing Head. adj: pertaining to the Wellhead, e.g.: Wellhead Pressure

A long steel Casing that uses an inclined plane to cause the Bit to deflect from the original Borehole at a slight angle. Whipstocks are sometimes used in controlled Directional Drilling, in straightening crooked Boreholes, and in Sidetracking to avoid unretrieved Fish
A special
purpose Packer placed in the Casing to permit a Sidetrack operation

cored device used to separate Cement and drilling fluid as they are being pumped down the inside of the Casing during Cementing operations. A wiper Plug also removes drilling Mud that adheres to the inside of the Casing

A short trip or testing trip also usually call this Condition Trip which is a short trip POOH to a certain shalower depth and then after observation Well RIH to TD. For reports they use its abbreviation: W/T
سیم استوانه ای بشکل میله یا نخ

تفنگ مشبک کاری لوله‌های جداری و. . . در چاه بکار میرود

A Cable composed of steel wires twisted around a central core of fiber or steel wire to create a rope of great strength and considerable flexibility. Wire rope is used as drilling line in Rotary and Cable

Tool Rigs , Coring Line, Servicing Line, Winch Line, and so on. It is often called Cable or Wireline; however, Wireline is a single, slender metal rod, usually very flexible. Also compare with : Wireline
Wire Line Logging or Running, a kind of job , actions or job's abbreviations which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
W/L, actions or job's abbreviations which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
کابل سیمی فولادی جهت عملیات نمودار گیری مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
A small
diameter metal line used in Wireline operations. Also called : Slick Line. Compare also with : Conductor Line
A flared
end Sub run on the end of the Tubing String to permit easy access of wireline tools into the Tubing ID
end sub run on the end of the tubing string to permit easy access of wireline tools into the tubing ID
A tool used to Gauge and clean Junk and debris from the Casing in conjunction with a Junk catcher
A Formation fluid sampling device, actually run on Conductor Line rather than Wireline, that also Logs flow and shut

in pressure in rock near the Borehole. A spring mechanism holds a pad firmly against the sidewall while a piston creates a vacuum in a test chamber. Formation fluids enter the test chamber through a valve in the Pad. A recorder Logs the rate at which the test chamber is filled. Fluids may also be drawn to fill a sampling chamber. Wireline Formation tests may be done any number of times during one trip in the Hole, so they are very useful in Formation Testing
WLR, actions or job's abbreviations which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
لاگ یا نمودار گیری کابلی
A manually operated ram preventer especially adapted for closure around a wireline
Preventers installed on top of the well or drill string as a precautionary measure while running wirelines. The preventer packing will close around the wireline
A diagnostic tool used to ascertain the position of a gas leak in the Tubing of a gas lift Well
A general term often used to refer to any type of Log being run in a Well
A general term often used to refer to any type of Log being run in a Well. See also : Log

عملیات کار بر روی فیش یا ماندە درون چاه
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
WP
فشارموجود در حین کار
The pressure to which a particular piece of equipment is subjected during normal operations

To perform one or more of a variety of remedial operations on a producing Oil Well to try to increase production. Examples of workover operations are deepening, Plugging back, Pulling and resetting Liners, squeeze Cementing, and so on
Any type of fluid used in the workover operation of Well. See also : Completion Fluid
See : Production Rig. Also see : Pulling Unit
The String of Drill Pipe or Tubing suspended in a Well to which is attached a special tool or device that is used to carry out a certain task, such as : Squeeze Cementing or Fishing
A string of pipe used in workover of Well
servicing operations, not typically considered as production Tubing
See : Weevils
